title: Bubur Ayam
author: Admin
content: Bubur Ayam is one of Indonesia’s most popular breakfast dishes. It’s light, warm, and easy to digest, making it perfect to start the day with enough energy without feeling too heavy.
materials: Rice, shredded chicken, chicken broth, fried shallots, sweet soy sauce, celery leaves
steps:
1. Boil rice with chicken broth until it becomes porridge.
2. Add shredded chicken on top.
3. Serve with sweet soy sauce, celery leaves, and fried shallots.

title: Nasi Uduk
author: Admin
content: Nasi Uduk is steamed rice cooked in coconut milk and spices, giving it a rich aroma and savory flavor. It’s usually served with eggs, tempeh, and chili sauce for a complete breakfast.
materials: Rice, coconut milk, lemongrass, bay leaves, boiled egg, fried tempeh, sambal
steps:
1. Cook rice with coconut milk, lemongrass, and bay leaves until done.
2. Serve with boiled egg, fried tempeh, and sambal.
3. Enjoy while warm.

title: Lontong Sayur
author: Admin
content: Lontong Sayur is a traditional Betawi breakfast dish made from rice cakes served with spicy coconut milk soup and vegetables. It’s a flavorful and hearty way to start the day.
materials: Rice cakes, chayote, coconut milk, spice paste, boiled egg, sambal goreng
steps:
1. Stir-fry the spice paste until fragrant.
2. Add coconut milk and chayote, cook until tender.
3. Serve with rice cakes and boiled egg.

title: Grilled Bread
author: Admin
content: Roti Bakar is a popular Indonesian breakfast or snack. This version combines chocolate and cheese for a sweet and savory flavor that melts perfectly on warm toasted bread.
materials: White bread, chocolate spread, grated cheese, butter, condensed milk
steps:
1. Spread butter on both sides of the bread and grill until golden.
2. Add chocolate spread and grated cheese between slices.
3. Drizzle with condensed milk before serving.

title: Ketoprak
author: Admin
content: Ketoprak is a traditional Jakarta breakfast made with rice vermicelli, tofu, bean sprouts, and peanut sauce. It’s filling, nutritious, and packed with local flavor.
materials: Rice vermicelli, fried tofu, bean sprouts, peanut sauce, rice cake, fried shallots
steps:
1. Prepare peanut sauce by blending peanuts, garlic, chili, and sweet soy sauce.
2. Arrange tofu, vermicelli, and bean sprouts on a plate.
3. Pour peanut sauce over and sprinkle with fried shallots.
